bibl.author: Benton H. Wilson
bibl.title: Benton H. Wilson to Walt Whitman, 6 October 1868
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: I have neglected to answer your last letter so long that I am most ashamed to write to you now but I know that you will excuse my seeming neglect for I have been very busy for the past three months.

This letter will be handed to you by our esteemed Friend Miss Kate C Riley of Washington who I would like to introduce to you. We made her
acquaintance at the same time we did yours and under the same circumstance, performing acts of kindness to Sick & wounded Soldiers. She has made us several flying visits this summer & I have taken the liberty of sending you this letter of Introduction by her.
She can talk to you about David & myself from having seen us lately. My little baby Walt is well & Bright as a dollar. with Love to yourself I will close for the present.
